00124 #define UI_RETURN_OK        2       /* choice made */
00125 #define UI_RETURN_OUT       4       /* left the menu */
00126 #define UI_RETURN_UPDATE    8       /* update the button that opened */
00127 #define UI_RETURN_POPUP_OK  16      /* popup is ok to be handled */

00129     /* block->flag bits 12-15 are identical to but->flag bits */

00150 #define UI_BUT_ALIGN_TOP    (1<<14)
00151 #define UI_BUT_ALIGN_LEFT   (1<<15)
00152 #define UI_BUT_ALIGN_RIGHT  (1<<16)
00153 #define UI_BUT_ALIGN_DOWN   (1<<17)

00162 #define UI_BUT_LAST_ACTIVE  (1<<25)
00163 #define UI_BUT_UNDO         (1<<26)
00164 #define UI_BUT_IMMEDIATE    (1<<27)
00165 #define UI_BUT_NO_TOOLTIP   (1<<28)
00166 #define UI_BUT_NO_UTF8      (1<<29)

00168 #define UI_BUT_VEC_SIZE_LOCK (1<<30) /* used to flag if color hsv-circle should keep luminance */
00169 #define UI_BUT_COLOR_CUBIC  (1<<31) /* cubic saturation for the color wheel */
00170 
00171 #define UI_PANEL_WIDTH          340
00172 #define UI_COMPACT_PANEL_WIDTH  160
00173 
00174 /* scale fixed button widths by this to account for DPI
00175  * 8.4852 == sqrtf(72.0f)) */
00176 #define UI_DPI_FAC (sqrtf((float)U.dpi) / 8.48528137423857f)
00177 #define UI_DPI_ICON_FAC (((float)U.dpi) / 72.0f)
00178 /* 16 to copy ICON_DEFAULT_HEIGHT */
00179 #define UI_DPI_ICON_SIZE ((float)16 * UI_DPI_ICON_FAC)
00180 
00181 /* Button types, bits stored in 1 value... and a short even!
00182  * - bits 0-4:  bitnr (0-31)
00183  * - bits 5-7:  pointer type
00184  * - bit  8:    for 'bit'
00185  * - bit  9-15: button type (now 6 bits, 64 types)
00186  * */
00187 
00188 #define CHA 32
00189 #define SHO 64
00190 #define INT 96
00191 #define FLO 128
00192 /*#define FUN   192*/ /*UNUSED*/
00193 #define BIT 256
00194 
00195 #define BUTPOIN (128+64+32)
00196 
00197 #define BUT (1<<9)
00198 #define ROW (2<<9)
00199 #define TOG (3<<9)
00200 #define SLI (4<<9)
00201 #define NUM (5<<9)
00202 #define TEX (6<<9)
00203 #define TOG3    (7<<9)
00204 #define TOGR    (8<<9)
00205 #define TOGN    (9<<9)
00206 #define LABEL   (10<<9)
00207 #define MENU    (11<<9)
00208 #define ICONROW (12<<9)
00209 #define ICONTOG (13<<9)
00210 #define NUMSLI  (14<<9)
00211 #define COL     (15<<9)
00212 #define IDPOIN  (16<<9)
00213 #define HSVSLI  (17<<9)
00214 #define SCROLL  (18<<9)
00215 #define BLOCK   (19<<9)
00216 #define BUTM    (20<<9)
00217 #define SEPR    (21<<9)
00218 #define LINK    (22<<9)
00219 #define INLINK  (23<<9)
00220 #define KEYEVT  (24<<9)
00221 #define ICONTEXTROW (25<<9)
00222 #define HSVCUBE     (26<<9)
00223 #define PULLDOWN    (27<<9)
00224 #define ROUNDBOX    (28<<9)
00225 #define CHARTAB     (29<<9)
00226 #define BUT_COLORBAND (30<<9)
00227 #define BUT_NORMAL  (31<<9)
00228 #define BUT_CURVE   (32<<9)
00229 #define BUT_TOGDUAL (33<<9)
00230 #define ICONTOGN    (34<<9)
00231 #define FTPREVIEW   (35<<9)
00232 #define NUMABS      (36<<9)
00233 #define TOGBUT      (37<<9)
00234 #define OPTION      (38<<9)
00235 #define OPTIONN     (39<<9)
00236 #define TRACKPREVIEW    (40<<9)
00237         /* buttons with value >= SEARCH_MENU don't get undo pushes */
00238 #define SEARCH_MENU (41<<9)
00239 #define BUT_EXTRA   (42<<9)
00240 #define HSVCIRCLE   (43<<9)
00241 #define LISTBOX     (44<<9)
00242 #define LISTROW     (45<<9)
00243 #define HOTKEYEVT   (46<<9)
00244 #define BUT_IMAGE   (47<<9)
00245 #define HISTOGRAM   (48<<9)
00246 #define WAVEFORM    (49<<9)
00247 #define VECTORSCOPE (50<<9)
00248 #define PROGRESSBAR (51<<9)
00249 
00250 #define BUTTYPE     (63<<9)
00251

00283 /* Callbacks
00284  *
00285  * uiBlockSetHandleFunc/ButmFunc are for handling events through a callback.
00286  * HandleFunc gets the retval passed on, and ButmFunc gets a2. The latter is
00287  * mostly for compatibility with older code.
00288  *
00289  * uiButSetCompleteFunc is for tab completion.
00290  *
00291  * uiButSearchFunc is for name buttons, showing a popup with matches
00292  *
00293  * uiBlockSetFunc and uiButSetFunc are callbacks run when a button is used,
00294  * in case events, operators or RNA are not sufficient to handle the button.
00295  *
00296  * uiButSetNFunc will free the argument with MEM_freeN. */
00297 
00298 typedef struct uiSearchItems uiSearchItems;
00299 
00300 typedef void (*uiButHandleFunc)(struct bContext *C, void *arg1, void *arg2);
00301 typedef void (*uiButHandleRenameFunc)(struct bContext *C, void *arg, char *origstr);
00302 typedef void (*uiButHandleNFunc)(struct bContext *C, void *argN, void *arg2);
00303 typedef void (*uiButCompleteFunc)(struct bContext *C, char *str, void *arg);
00304 typedef void (*uiButSearchFunc)(const struct bContext *C, void *arg, const char *str, uiSearchItems *items);
00305 typedef void (*uiBlockHandleFunc)(struct bContext *C, void *arg, int event);
00306

00310 typedef void (*uiMenuHandleFunc)(struct bContext *C, void *arg, int event);

00312 /* Popup Menus
00313  *
00314  * Functions used to create popup menus. For more extended menus the
00315  * uiPupMenuBegin/End functions can be used to define own items with
00316  * the uiItem functions in between. If it is a simple confirmation menu
00317  * or similar, popups can be created with a single function call. */
00318 
00319 typedef struct uiPopupMenu uiPopupMenu;
00320

00344 /* Popup Blocks

00359 /* Blocks
00360  *
00361  * Functions for creating, drawing and freeing blocks. A Block is a
00362  * container of buttons and used for various purposes.
00363  * 
00364  * Begin/Define Buttons/End/Draw is the typical order in which these
00365  * function should be called, though for popup blocks Draw is left out.
00366  * Freeing blocks is done by the screen/ module automatically.
00367  *
00368  * */
00369 
00370 uiBlock *uiBeginBlock(const struct bContext *C, struct ARegion *region, const char *name, short dt);
00371 void uiEndBlock(const struct bContext *C, uiBlock *block);
00372 void uiDrawBlock(const struct bContext *C, struct uiBlock *block);
00373 
00374 uiBlock *uiGetBlock(const char *name, struct ARegion *ar);
00375 
00376 void uiBlockSetEmboss(uiBlock *block, char dt);
00377

00380 void uiFreeInactiveBlocks(const struct bContext *C, struct ListBase *lb);
00381 void uiFreeActiveButtons(const struct bContext *C, struct bScreen *screen);
00382 
00383 void uiBlockSetRegion(uiBlock *block, struct ARegion *region);
00384

00511 /* Special Buttons
00512  *
00513  * Buttons with a more specific purpose:
00514  * - IDPoinBut: for creating buttons that work on a pointer to an ID block.
00515  * - MenuBut: buttons that popup a menu (in headers usually).
00516  * - PulldownBut: like MenuBut, but creating a uiBlock (for compatibility).
00517  * - BlockBut: buttons that popup a block with more buttons.
00518  * - KeyevtBut: buttons that can be used to turn key events into values.
00519  * - PickerButtons: buttons like the color picker (for code sharing).
00520  * - AutoButR: RNA property button with type automatically defined. */
00521 
00522 #define UI_ID_RENAME        1
00523 #define UI_ID_BROWSE        2
00524 #define UI_ID_ADD_NEW       4
00525 #define UI_ID_OPEN          8
00526 #define UI_ID_ALONE         16
00527 #define UI_ID_DELETE        32
00528 #define UI_ID_LOCAL         64
00529 #define UI_ID_AUTO_NAME     128
00530 #define UI_ID_FAKE_USER     256
00531 #define UI_ID_PIN           512
00532 #define UI_ID_BROWSE_RENDER 1024
00533 #define UI_ID_PREVIEWS      2048
00534 #define UI_ID_FULL          (UI_ID_RENAME|UI_ID_BROWSE|UI_ID_ADD_NEW|UI_ID_OPEN|UI_ID_ALONE|UI_ID_DELETE|UI_ID_LOCAL)
00535 
00536 typedef void (*uiIDPoinFuncFP)(struct bContext *C, const char *str, struct ID **idpp);
00537 typedef void (*uiIDPoinFunc)(struct bContext *C, struct ID *id, int event);
00538 
00539 uiBut *uiDefIDPoinBut(uiBlock *block, uiIDPoinFuncFP func, short blocktype, int retval, const char *str,
00540                         int x1, int y1, short x2, short y2, void *idpp, const char *tip);
00541 
00542 int uiIconFromID(struct ID *id);
00543

00545 uiBut *uiDefMenuBut(uiBlock *block, uiMenuCreateFunc func, void *arg, const char *str, int x1, int y1, short x2, short y2, const char *tip);
00546 uiBut *uiDefIconTextMenuBut(uiBlock *block, uiMenuCreateFunc func, void *arg, int icon, const char *str, int x1, int y1, short x2, short y2, const char *tip);
00547 uiBut *uiDefIconMenuBut(uiBlock *block, uiMenuCreateFunc func, void *arg, int icon, int x1, int y1, short x2, short y2, const char *tip);

00595 /* Autocomplete
00596  *
00597  * Tab complete helper functions, for use in uiButCompleteFunc callbacks.
00598  * Call begin once, then multiple times do_name with all possibilities,
00599  * and finally end to finish and get the completed name. */
00600 
00601 typedef struct AutoComplete AutoComplete;
00602 
00603 AutoComplete *autocomplete_begin(const char *startname, size_t maxlen);
00604 void autocomplete_do_name(AutoComplete *autocpl, const char *name);
00605 void autocomplete_end(AutoComplete *autocpl, char *autoname);

00620 /* Handlers
00621  *
00622  * Handlers that can be registered in regions, areas and windows for
00623  * handling WM events. Mostly this is done automatic by modules such
00624  * as screen/ if ED_KEYMAP_UI is set, or internally in popup functions. */
00625 
00626 void UI_add_region_handlers(struct ListBase *handlers);
00627 void UI_add_popup_handlers(struct bContext *C, struct ListBase *handlers, uiPopupBlockHandle *popup);

00629 
00630 /* Module
00631  *
00632  * init and exit should be called before using this module. init_userdef must
00633  * be used to reinitialize some internal state if user preferences change. */
00634

00636 void UI_init_userdef(void);
00637 void UI_reinit_font(void);
00638 void UI_exit(void);

00640 /* Layout
00641  *
00642  * More automated layout of buttons. Has three levels:
00643  * - Layout: contains a number templates, within a bounded width or height.
00644  * - Template: predefined layouts for buttons with a number of slots, each
00645  *   slot can contain multiple items.
00646  * - Item: item to put in a template slot, being either an RNA property,
00647  *   operator, label or menu. Also regular buttons can be used when setting
00648  *   uiBlockCurLayout. */
00649 
00650 /* layout */
00651 #define UI_LAYOUT_HORIZONTAL    0
00652 #define UI_LAYOUT_VERTICAL      1
00653 
00654 #define UI_LAYOUT_PANEL         0
00655 #define UI_LAYOUT_HEADER        1
00656 #define UI_LAYOUT_MENU          2
00657 #define UI_LAYOUT_TOOLBAR       3
00658  
00659 #define UI_UNIT_X               U.widget_unit
00660 #define UI_UNIT_Y               U.widget_unit
00661 
00662 #define UI_LAYOUT_ALIGN_EXPAND  0
00663 #define UI_LAYOUT_ALIGN_LEFT    1
00664 #define UI_LAYOUT_ALIGN_CENTER  2
00665 #define UI_LAYOUT_ALIGN_RIGHT   3
00666 
00667 #define UI_ITEM_O_RETURN_PROPS  1
00668 #define UI_ITEM_R_EXPAND        2
00669 #define UI_ITEM_R_SLIDER        4
00670 #define UI_ITEM_R_TOGGLE        8
00671 #define UI_ITEM_R_ICON_ONLY     16
00672 #define UI_ITEM_R_EVENT         32
00673 #define UI_ITEM_R_FULL_EVENT    64
00674 #define UI_ITEM_R_NO_BG         128
00675 #define UI_ITEM_R_IMMEDIATE     256
00676 
00677 /* uiLayoutOperatorButs flags */
00678 #define UI_LAYOUT_OP_SHOW_TITLE 1
00679 #define UI_LAYOUT_OP_SHOW_EMPTY 2
00680 
00681 /* flags to set which corners will become rounded:
00682  *
00683  * 1------2
00684  * |      |
00685  * 8------4 */
00686 
00687 enum {
00688     UI_CNR_TOP_LEFT= 1,
00689     UI_CNR_TOP_RIGHT= 2,
00690     UI_CNR_BOTTOM_RIGHT= 4,
00691     UI_CNR_BOTTOM_LEFT= 8,
00692     /* just for convenience */
00693     UI_CNR_NONE= 0,
00694     UI_CNR_ALL= (UI_CNR_TOP_LEFT | UI_CNR_TOP_RIGHT | UI_CNR_BOTTOM_RIGHT | UI_CNR_BOTTOM_LEFT)
00695 };
00696 
00697 /* not apart of the corner flags but mixed in some functions  */
00698 #define UI_RB_ALPHA (UI_CNR_ALL + 1)
00699
